section.title: Building Solutions
section.para: Running SolutionStudio gathers solution content, processes it, and creates a complete solution.

section.title: Build Input
section.para: SolutionStudio uses three classes of input to create solutions: a base operating system, package repositories, and configuration files and scripts. Solution content is specified using a solution definition.

itemizedlist.listitem: Base Operating System. SolutionStudio requires a base operating system solution as input for creating new solutions. The base operating system is defined at the level of operating system name (Red Hat Enterprise Linux or CentOS), version (5) and architecture (i386 or x86_64). The four base operating systems SolutionStudio supports are RHEL-5-i386, RHEL-5-x86_64, CentOS-5-i386 and CentOS-5-x86_64. Base operating system solutions must include both network installation images and package repositories. Base operating system solution are covered in more detail under .

Package Repositories. SolutionStudio uses RPM package repositories to locate and download software components for the solution. SolutionStudio requires at least one package repository, that of the base operating system solution. A typical solution definition will specify multiple input repositories, including the base operating system update repository, and repositories made available from other internal and external providers. See for more information.

Configuration Files and Scripts. The final category of solution content is user-provided configuration files and scripts. Files are copied, and scripts are executed, during client machine installation and updates. For more information, see .

section.title: Build Process
section.para: SolutionStudio uses information from the to gather solution content. It processes this information in three primary ways.

listitem.para: Creates a configuration package. SolutionStudio creates a in RPM format. This package contains configuration files and scripts specified in the solution definition. It also contains SolutionStudio-generated YUM update configuration. See for more information on SolutionStudio-generated YUM configuration.

During this step, SolutionStudio also creates a , if one does not exist, in the same folder as the solution definition. The file has a .dat extension. SolutionStudio uses the data file to track and increment the configuration package release number.

itemizedlist.listitem: Assembles a package repository. Using the solution definition, SolutionStudio compiles a list of required packages. It then resolves package dependencies, downloads packages, adds the configuration package (mentioned in the previous item) and creates a complete, self-contained package repository. The package repository is used during network installations to client machines. It is also used during client machine updates.

Customizes network install images. SolutionStudio downloads network installation images from the base operating system and modifies them to include solution-specific information. By default, SolutionStudio configures the installer program contained within the images to access solution content from the solution's . This allows client machines to be installed over the network without needing to provide the download location manually at installation time. SolutionStudio can also be used to completely automate client installations. See for more information.

section.para: SolutionStudio stores solution content, both input and generated, in the cache folder, by default /var/cache/solutionstudio/. It reuses information from the cache on subsequent runs, where possible, to improve build performance.

section.title: Build Output
section.para: SolutionStudio outputs a complete solution, a solution data file and a log file.

itemizedlist.listitem: Solution. The primary output of the build process is a complete solution containing solution-specific network installation images and a package repository. Using network installation images you can deploy the solution to one or more physical or virtual client machines. See for more information. The solution package repository supports client machine updates using YUM. The section provides an overview of SolutionStudio's client machine update features.
Solution Data File. As mentioned above, SolutionStudio creates a during the build process. This file is used to track and increment the release number of the configuration package.
SolutionStudio Log File. SolutionStudio sends output both to the screen and to a log file, located by default at /var/log/solutionstudio.log.

section.para: In summary, SolutionStudio is a production solution life cycle manager for use in defining, building and maintaining solutions that can be easily installed and updated on physical and virtual machines using industry standard deployment and update tools.
